CitaviR 0.2.0

Detect the language that the abstract or other fields are written in

Source: R/detect_language.R
detect_language.Rd

Currently this only works for files that were generated while Citavi was set to "English" so that column names are "Short Title" etc.

detect_language(
  CitDat,
  fieldsToDetectIn = c("Abstract"),
  wantedLanguage = c("english")
)

Arguments

CitDat

A dataframe/tibble possibly returned by read_Citavi_xlsx.
fieldsToDetectIn

Character vector with names of fields whose text language should be detected. Default is c("Abstract"). When multiple fields are given (e.g. c("Abstract", "Title")), they are combined into a single string whose language is then detected.
wantedLanguage

Character vector with names of languages that are desired. Default is c("english"). If not set to NULL, a new column det_lang_wanted is created, which is TRUE if the detected language in det_lang is a wanted language.

Value

A tibble containing at least one additional column: det_lang.

Examples

path <- example_xlsx("3dupsin5refs.xlsx")
read_Citavi_xlsx(path) %>%
   detect_language()

#> # A tibble: 5 x 21
#>   ID     `Short title`  Title Year  Author Categories Groups Abstract `DOI name`
#>   <chr>  <chr>          <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr>      <chr>  <chr>    <chr>     
#> 1 7e04d~ Schmidt, Hart~ Esti~ 2019  Schmi~ 1 catA     Googl~ Broad-s~ 10.2135/c~
#> 2 2481c~ Schmidt, Hart~ Heri~ 2019  Schmi~ 1 catA     Googl~ In plan~ 10.1534/g~
#> 3 db3ab~ Schmidt, Hart~ Heri~ 2019  Schmi~ 2 catB     PubMed In plan~ NA        
#> 4 ba575~ Schmidt, Hart~ Hrit~ 2019  Schmi~ 1 catA     TypoDB In plan~ 10.1534/g~
#> 5 fa402~ Schmidt, Möhr~ More~ 2018  Schmi~ 2 catB     Googl~ Traditi~ 10.2135/c~
#> # ... with 12 more variables: PubMed ID <chr>, Online address <chr>,
#> #   Periodical <chr>, Volume <chr>, Number <chr>, Page range <chr>,
#> #   Locations <chr>, has_attachment <lgl>, red_flag <lgl>, blue_circle <lgl>,
#> #   det_lang <chr>, det_lang_wanted <lgl>
